intro: Castanopsis cavaleriei, commonly known as the Chinese tanoak, is a species of evergreen tree belonging to the Fagaceae family. It is native to southeastern China, particularly in the provinces of Guangdong and Guangxi. The tree can grow up to 30 meters tall, featuring a straight trunk and a broad, spreading crown. Its leaves are革质 (leathery), alternate, and elliptical in shape, with a glossy upper surface and a lighter underside. The plant produces small, cup-shaped fruits that contain one or two seeds, typical of the Fagaceae family.
